summary: Tested automatic Adult/Pediatric case sheet selection feature. Found and fixed 1 critical bug (missing Badge import in CaseSheetForm.js). All 6 test scenarios passed after fix.

fixed_bugs.issue: Missing Badge import causing 'Badge is not defined' runtime error when navigating from Triage to Case Sheet
fixed_bugs.fix: Added import { Badge } from '@/components/ui/badge' to line 11

passed_tests: Triage: Age '6 months' shows Pediatric badge
Triage: Age 16 shows Adult badge (boundary case)
Triage: Age 15 shows Pediatric badge (boundary case)
Triage: Pediatric vitals reference table appears for pediatric ages
Triage: Adult vitals reference appears for adult ages
Case Sheet: isPediatric state set from triage navigation data
Case Sheet: Pink 'PEDIATRIC CASE SHEET ACTIVE' banner appears for pediatric patients
Case Sheet: Patient age auto-populated from triage
Case Sheet: Editing age to adult (25) removes pediatric banner
Case Sheet: Editing age to pediatric (8) shows pediatric banner and toast notification
critical_code_review_comments: Fixed: Missing Badge import in CaseSheetForm.js - was causing runtime error when navigating from Triage to Case Sheet with pediatric patient
context_for_next_testing_agent: Pediatric detection feature fully working. Key test flows: 1) Triage page - enter age < 16 to see Pediatric badge, 2) Calculate triage and create case sheet, 3) Case sheet shows pink PEDIATRIC CASE SHEET ACTIVE banner with age badge, 4) Editing age in case sheet dynamically updates pediatric status with toast notification. Badge import was missing and has been fixed.
